name.en: Chair of International Business and Innovation

structural_unit_name.en: Chair of International Business and Innovation

description.en: This course covers the evolution of the business environment and the geographically defined economies in the Asia Pacific region. It covers all economies in the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) including China, Japan, Korea, south Asian countries, and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). This course provides an insight into the geoeconomics and geopolitics in Asia Pacific and the strategies and organizational structures of companies from Asia, including the Japanese keiretsu, Korean Chaebol and Chinese state enterprises and family business.
description.et: Käesolev kursus hõlmab Aasia ja Vaikse Ookeani piirkonna ärikeskkona ja selles regioonis geograafiliselt eristatavate majanduste arengut. Aasia ja Vaikse Ookeani piirkond katab kõiki majandusi APEC piirkonnas, muuhulgas Hiina, Jaapan, Korea, Lõuna-Aasia riigid (k.a. ASEAN). Kursus võimaldab paremat arusaamist geoökonoomikast ja geopoliitikast Aasia ja Vaikse Ookeani piirkonnas. Ühtlasi annab see arusaama ettevõtete strateegiatest ja organisatsioonide struktuuridest Aasias - näiteks Jaapani keiretsu, Korea chaebol ja Hiina riigiettevõtted ning pereettevõtted.

objectives.en: Over the past two decades, the Asia-Pacific region has experienced a resurgence of economic activity and investment. More than the traditional flying geese model or Asian miracle as led by Japan, the rise of China in particular, is deemed by economists, sociologists and other academics alike as one of the pivotal development in the region. This course introduces students to the economic, political and sociocultural theories and frameworks for understanding the context of business in the Asia Pacific region and the application of contextual and local knowledge to the decision-making processes of companies operating in the region.
objectives.et: Viimase kahe aasta kümne jooksul on Aasia ja Vaikse Ookeani piirkonnas kerkinud kasavava kiirusega esile majanduslik aktiivsus ja investeeringud. Rohkem kui traditsiooniline "lendava hane" mudel või "Aasia ime", mida juhtis Jaapan, on eriti Hiina esiletõus majandusteadlaste, sotsioloogide ja teiste teadlaste hinnangul murrangulise tähtsusega sündmus. Käesolev kursus tutvustab üliõpilastele majanduslikke, poliitilisi ja sotsiokultuurilisi teooriaid ja raamistikke mõistmaks Aasia ja Vaikse Ookeani piirkonna ärikonteksti ning sealsete ettevõtete otsustusprotsesse.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of this course, students will be able to: Learn more about socio-cultural, political and economic systems in the Asia Pacific region. 2. Identify business opportunities presented by emerging industries in the Asia Pacific region, and ASEAN 3. Gain insights into business and/or career opportunities in the Asia Pacific region and ASEAN.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõpuks üliõpilane: 1. Omab teadmisi sotsiaal-kultuurilistest, poliitilistest ja majanduslikest süsteemidest Aasia ja Vaikse Ookeani piirkondades. 2. Suudab tuvastada ärivõimalusi arenevates tööstusriikides Aasia, Vaikse ookeani ja Kagu-Aasia piirkonnas. 3. Omandab sissevaate ärilistesse ja karjäärivõimalustesse Aasia, Vaikse Ookeani ja Kagu-Aasia piirkondades.

independent_work.et: Prepare group presentations and class exercise

grade_evaluation.et:
Individual Participation:  10% 
In class report and class activity: 20%
Group Project Presentation: 20%
Final Exam: 50%

debt_elimination.et: One final exam re-take.  Students should adhere to the deadlines of homework.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
The geopolitical building blocks of Asia: North East Asia, Greater China, ASEAN, South Asia, Central Asia   
Asian capitalism is undergoing a radical structural transformation. These changes are directly affecting its key institutions: governments, companies, labor relations, etc. As a result Asian economic systems are becoming much closer to the Western-style, especially Anglo-Saxon capitalism, though the region retains some important specific features, especially regarding business culture. We will discuss the geopolitical building blocks of Asia which includes North East Asia, Greater China, ASEAN, South Asia, Central Asia.
The following is the link from Wikipedia about the background information of trade war between US and China. Please read it and we will discuss in the next class 
1. What would China lose in an all-out trade war between the United States and China?
2. What would the United States lose? 
3. Explain the potential impact of a bilateral trade war on Europe?
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_China-United_States_trade_war
